member.name: T:Flame.Optimization.AccessChecker
member.summary: Defines access checking techniques.

member.name: F:Flame.Optimization.AccessChecker.currentType
member.summary: The current type, which is used to access other types, fields and methods.

member.name: F:Flame.Optimization.AccessChecker.invalidAccess
member.summary: Tells if invalid access has been detected.

member.name: T:Flame.Optimization.ConciseFlowPass
member.summary: Defines a pass that makes control flow more concise. This pass will convert low-level constructs (tagged statements) to their high-level equivalents, such as 'while' and 'do...while' loops, where doing so is the 'natural' thing to do: i.e. it does not change the semantics of the original node tree, and encapsulates things like loop conditions in their 'logical' positions.
member.remarks: Currently, this pass does the following: * Convert tagged statements that end in `continue;` into `while (true) { ... }` loops. TODO: * Convert tagged statements that end in `if (Condition) { continue; }` into 'do...while' loops. * Convert `while (Condition1) { ... }` loops that start with `if (Condition2) { break; }` into `while (Condition1 && !Condition2) { ... }` loops.

member.name: T:Flame.Optimization.SpeculativeFlowState
member.summary: A state for the `FinalFlowRemover` node visitor.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.SpeculativeFlowState.WithStatement(Flame.Optimization.SpeculativeStatement)
member.summary: Creates a new speculative flow state that represents the current state with the addition of a speculative statement.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.SpeculativeFlowState.RemoveSpeculativeStatements
member.summary: Removes all speculative final statements for this state. `false` is returned if no speculative final statements were removed (because this state didn't have any), otherwise `true`.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.SpeculativeFlowState.Sequence(Flame.Optimization.SpeculativeFlowState)
member.summary: Creates a speculative flow state that represents the sequence of the this flow state followed by the give state.

member.name: P:Flame.Optimization.SpeculativeFlowState.HasSpeculativeStatements
member.summary: Determines whether this speculative flow state has any final statements.

member.name: P:Flame.Optimization.SpeculativeFlowState.SpeculativeStatements
member.summary: Gets the speculative final statements for this state.

member.name: P:Flame.Optimization.SpeculativeFlowState.IsTerminated
member.summary: Finds out if this speculative flow state has been terminated.

member.name: T:Flame.Optimization.FinalFlowRemover
member.summary: A visitor that matches control flow statements, such as `break` and `continue` at the end of an enclosing control flow statement such as a tagged block, a `while` loop, a `do...while` loop or a `for` loop. Said enclosing statement is then transformed.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.FinalFlowRemover.CreateCollapsedFlow(Flame.Optimization.SpeculativeFlowState,Flame.Optimization.SpeculativeFlowState)
member.summary: Computes the "sum" of a flow state and a control flow delta.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.FinalFlowRemover.CreateDeltaFlow(Flame.Optimization.SpeculativeFlowState,Flame.Optimization.SpeculativeFlowState)
member.summary: Computes the "difference" between two flow states, such that the "sum" of the first flow state and the result of this operation results in the second state.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.FinalFlowRemover.CreateSequenceFlow(Flame.Optimization.SpeculativeFlowState,Flame.Optimization.SpeculativeFlowState)
member.summary: Creates a flow delta that represents the sequential execution of two flow deltas.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.FinalFlowRemover.CreateSelectFlow(Flame.Optimization.SpeculativeFlowState,Flame.Optimization.SpeculativeFlowState)
member.summary: Creates a flow delta that represents selecting precisely one of two flow deltas.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.FinalFlowRemover.CreateLoopFlow(Flame.Compiler.BlockTag,Flame.Optimization.SpeculativeFlowState)
member.summary: Creates a flow delta that will be executed zero or more times.

member.name: P:Flame.Optimization.FinalFlowRemover.TerminatedFlow
member.summary: Gets a flow delta that represents flow termination: sequential flow that succeeds it will never be executed.

member.name: P:Flame.Optimization.FinalFlowRemover.EnclosingFlow
member.summary: Gets the final flow remover's enclosing flow statement.

member.name: P:Flame.Optimization.FinalFlowRemover.MatchesInnerFlow
member.summary: Matches the speculative flow statement. This delegate's first argument represents the enclosing statement, whereas the second argument represents the potential speculative flow statement.

member.name: P:Flame.Optimization.FinalFlowRemover.CurrentFlow
member.summary: Gets or sets the current flow state.

member.name: P:Flame.Optimization.InitialFlowState.IsInitial
member.summary: Determines whether this state is "initial": it succeeds the initial state directly.

member.name: T:Flame.Optimization.InitialFlowRemover
member.summary: A visitor that matches control flow statements, such as `break` and `continue` at the start of an enclosing control flow statement such as a tagged block, a `while` loop, a `do...while` loop or a `for` loop. Said enclosing statement is then transformed.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.InitialFlowRemover.CreateCollapsedFlow(Flame.Optimization.InitialFlowState,Flame.Optimization.InitialFlowState)
member.summary: Computes the "sum" of a flow state and a control flow delta.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.InitialFlowRemover.CreateDeltaFlow(Flame.Optimization.InitialFlowState,Flame.Optimization.InitialFlowState)
member.summary: Computes the "difference" between two flow states, such that the "sum" of the first flow state and the result of this operation results in the second state.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.InitialFlowRemover.CreateSequenceFlow(Flame.Optimization.InitialFlowState,Flame.Optimization.InitialFlowState)
member.summary: Creates a flow delta that represents the sequential execution of two flow deltas.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.InitialFlowRemover.CreateSelectFlow(Flame.Optimization.InitialFlowState,Flame.Optimization.InitialFlowState)
member.summary: Creates a flow delta that represents selecting precisely one of two flow deltas.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.InitialFlowRemover.CreateLoopFlow(Flame.Compiler.BlockTag,Flame.Optimization.InitialFlowState)
member.summary: Creates a flow delta that will be executed zero or more times.

member.name: P:Flame.Optimization.InitialFlowRemover.TerminatedFlow
member.summary: Gets a flow delta that represents flow termination: sequential flow that succeeds it will never be executed.

member.name: P:Flame.Optimization.InitialFlowRemover.EnclosingFlow
member.summary: Gets the final flow remover's enclosing flow statement.

member.name: P:Flame.Optimization.InitialFlowRemover.MatchesInnerFlow
member.summary: Matches the final flow statement. This delegate's first argument represents the enclosing statement, whereas the second argument represents the potential final flow statement.

member.name: P:Flame.Optimization.InitialFlowRemover.CurrentFlow
member.summary: Gets or sets the current flow state.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.InliningExtensions.CanInline(Flame.IMethod,Flame.IType)
member.summary: Finds out whether a call to the given method can be inlined.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.InliningExtensions.CanInline(Flame.IMethod,Flame.Compiler.IExpression)
member.summary: Finds out whether a call to the given method can be inlined.

member.name: T:Flame.Optimization.SimplifyFlowPass
member.summary:
Defines a flow simplification pass: a pass that will simplify control flow statements. Applying this pass can simplify the code generated by the back-end, and allow other passes to make more accurate predictions about control flow.
This pass will reduce high-level control flow into lower-level constrol flow, usually tagged statements, if it deems said operation possibly profitable, but will not attempt to convert low-level control flow into higher-level control flow, regardless of the feasibility of the operation.
member.remarks: Currently, this pass does the following: * Remove final 'break' statements from tagged statements, and then try to reduce those to sequential flow. * Convert 'while' blocks that end in 'break' statements into 'if' blocks wrapped by a tagged statement, and try to reduce those to sequential flow. * Convert 'do...while' blocks that end in 'break' statements into tagged statements, and try to reduce those to sequential flow.

member.name: T:Flame.Optimization.SizeVisitor
member.summary: A node visitor that computes an approximate size of a syntax tree.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.SizeVisitor.CreateCollapsedFlow(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Computes the "sum" of a flow state and a control flow delta.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.SizeVisitor.CreateDeltaFlow(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Computes the "difference" between two flow states, such that the "sum" of the first flow state and the result of this operation results in the second state.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.SizeVisitor.CreateSequenceFlow(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a flow delta that represents the sequential execution of two flow deltas.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.SizeVisitor.CreateSelectFlow(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Selects precisely one of two flow paths.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.SizeVisitor.CreateLoopFlow(Flame.Compiler.BlockTag,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a flow state that "loops", i.e. will be executed zero or more times.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.SizeVisitor.Visit(Flame.Compiler.IExpression)
member.summary: "Visits" an expression: an expression is taken as input and transformed another expression.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.SizeVisitor.Visit(Flame.Compiler.IStatement)
member.summary: "Visits" a statement: an statement is taken as input and transformed another statement.

member.name: T:Flame.Optimization.SpeculativeStatement
member.summary: Defines a speculative statement: a statement that can first be defined and inserted into the node tree, and later be marked "alive" or "dead". "Dead" speculative statements are equivalent to the empty statement. "Alive" speculative statements are equivalent to the statement they contain.

member.name: P:Flame.Optimization.SpeculativeStatement.Contents
member.summary: Gets the speculative statement's inner statement.

member.name: P:Flame.Optimization.SpeculativeStatement.IsAlive
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean flag that tells if this speculative statement is "alive" or "dead".

member.name: T:Flame.Optimization.StatementRewriter
member.summary: A visitor that matches and then rewrites statements.

member.name: P:Flame.Optimization.StatementRewriter.MatchesStatement
member.summary: Finds out whether a given statement matches a set of criteria.

member.name: P:Flame.Optimization.StatementRewriter.TransformStatement
member.summary: Transforms a matched statement.

member.name: T:Flame.Optimization.InsertStatement
member.summary: Defines an insert statement: a statement that can later be populated with other statements.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.InsertStatement.Insert(Flame.Compiler.IStatement)
member.summary: Inserts the given statement.

member.name: P:Flame.Optimization.InsertStatement.Statements
member.summary: Gets all inserted statements.

member.summary: Gets the number of accesses, provided that this access count is not infinite.

member.summary: Gets an approximation of the total access count's lower bound.

member.name: P:Flame.Optimization.Variables.AccessMetrics.MaxAccess
member.summary: Gets an approximation of the total access count's upper bound.

member.name: P:Flame.Optimization.Variables.AccessMetrics.IsDefined
member.summary: Gets a boolean flag that tells if these access metrics' associated object has definitely been defined.
Computes the "sum" of a flow state and a control flow delta.
Computes the "difference" between two flow states, such that the "sum" of the first flow state and the result of this operation results in the second state.
Creates a flow delta that represents the sequential execution of two flow deltas.
Creates a flow delta that represents selecting precisely one of two flow deltas.

member.summary: Creates a flow delta that will be executed zero or more times.

member.summary: Gets all termination points for the given chain and tagged block. This method must be called after updating the chain's reach with this block.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.Variables.TerminatedBlockVariableFlow.UpdateReach(Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableDefinitionReach,Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableDefinitionChain)
member.summary: Updates the given variable reach, possibly using a pre-insert point.

member.name: T:Flame.Optimization.Variables.TransferDefinitionStatement
member.summary: A type of statement that represents a transfer of a chain's current definition to the backing variable of another. If both use the same backing variable, no action is taken.

member.name: P:Flame.Optimization.Variables.TransferDefinitionStatement.Chain
member.summary: Gets the variable definition chain whose value is taken.

member.name: P:Flame.Optimization.Variables.TransferDefinitionStatement.Access
member.summary: Gets the definition access that represents taking the chain's value.

member.name: P:Flame.Optimization.Variables.TransferDefinitionStatement.Definition
member.summary: Gets the variable definition reach this statement depends on. If this reach is live, the assignment is performed. Otherwise, nothing happens.

member.name: T:Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableDefinitionChain
member.summary: Defines a variable definition chain: a list of variable definitions and their reach.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableDefinitionChain.AddDefinition(Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableDefinitionReach)
member.summary: Adds a variable definition - and its reach - to this chain.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableDefinitionChain.GetDefinition(Flame.Optimization.Variables.IDefinitionAccess)
member.summary: Gets the variable definition that is associated with the given access identifier, if any. Otherwise, null.

member.name: P:Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableDefinitionChain.Type
member.summary: Gets this variable definition chain's type.

member.name: P:Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableDefinitionChain.Definitions
member.summary: Gets a sequence representing the definitions that belong to this variable definition chain, as well as their range.

member.name: P:Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableDefinitionChain.UsedVariables
member.summary: Gets the set of all used variables in this chain.

member.name: P:Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableDefinitionChain.MappedLocal
member.summary: Gets the original local this definition chain is mapped to. This need not correspond to the variable this definition chain is currently associated with.

member.name: T:Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableDefinitionReach
member.summary: Represents the reach of a single variable definition.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableDefinitionReach.GetLiveliness(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1{Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableDefinitionReach})
member.summary: Determines this definition' liveliness, based on a set of variable definitions whose liveliness depend on the outcome of this method. Said set is used to deal with cyclic variable definition dependencies.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableDefinitionReach.Contains(Flame.Optimization.Variables.IDefinitionAccess)
member.summary: Tests whether the given identifier is within this variable definition's reach.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableDefinitionReach.Add(Flame.Optimization.Variables.IDefinitionAccess)
member.summary: Adds a single identifier to this variable definition's reach.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableDefinitionReach.Add(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1{Flame.Optimization.Variables.IDefinitionAccess})
member.summary: Adds a set of identifiers to this variable definition's reach.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableDefinitionReach.Remove(Flame.Optimization.Variables.IDefinitionAccess)
member.summary: Removes a single identifier from this variable definition's reach.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableDefinitionReach.Remove(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1{Flame.Optimization.Variables.IDefinitionAccess})
member.summary: Removes a set of identifiers from this variable definition's reach.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableDefinitionReach.Transfer(Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableDefinitionReach,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1{Flame.Optimization.Variables.IDefinitionAccess})
member.summary: Transfers the given set of identifiers from this variable definition's reach to another's.

member.name: P:Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableDefinitionReach.IsVolatile
member.summary: Tests if this variable definition has been made volatile.

member.name: P:Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableDefinitionReach.IsLive
member.summary: Tests if this variable definition is live.

member.name: P:Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableDefinitionReach.Definition
member.summary: Gets the variable definition whose reach is represented.

member.name: P:Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableDefinitionReach.MappedLocal
member.summary: Gets the local this variable definition was originally mapped to.

member.name: P:Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableDefinitionReach.Reach
member.summary: Defines a set of identifiers that are within this variable definition's reach.

member.name: T:Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableDefinitionStatement
member.summary: A type of statement that represents an assignment associated with a single variable definition. The assignment remains live as long as the definition is live.

member.name: P:Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableDefinitionStatement.Definition
member.summary: Gets the variable definition reach this statement depends on. If this reach is live, the assignment is performed. Otherwise, the assignment's right-hand side is simply popped.

member.name: P:Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableDefinitionStatement.Value
member.summary: Gets the right-hand side of the variable assignment operation.

member.name: T:Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableDefinitionMarker
member.summary: A type of statement that marks a variable's definition, but does not do anything beyond that.

member.name: P:Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableDefinitionMarker.Definition
member.summary: Gets the variable definition that is marked here.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableDefinitionVisitor.Id``1(T)
member.summary: Identity helper function. For use as a delegate.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableDefinitionVisitor.IsPropagateAlwaysTypeCore(Flame.IType)
member.summary: Checks if the given type is a propagate-always type, which can safely be propagated anywhere.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableDefinitionVisitor.IsPropagateAlwaysType(Flame.IType)
member.summary: Checks if the given type is a propagate-always type, which can safely be propagated anywhere.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableDefinitionVisitor.CreateCollapsedFlow(Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableFlowState,Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableFlowState(Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableFlowState))
member.summary: Computes the "sum" of a flow state and a control flow delta.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableDefinitionVisitor.CreateDeltaFlow(Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableFlowState,Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableFlowState)
member.summary: Computes the "difference" between two flow states, such that the "sum" of the first flow state and the result of this operation results in the second state.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableDefinitionVisitor.CreateSequenceFlow(Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableFlowState(Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableFlowState),Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableFlowState(Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableFlowState))
member.summary: Creates a flow delta that represents the sequential execution of two flow deltas.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableDefinitionVisitor.CreateSelectFlow(Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableFlowState(Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableFlowState),Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableFlowState(Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableFlowState))
member.summary: Creates a flow delta that represents selecting precisely one of two flow deltas.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableDefinitionVisitor.CreateLoopFlow(Flame.Compiler.BlockTag,Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableFlowState(Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableFlowState))
member.summary: Creates a flow delta that will be executed zero or more times.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableDefinitionVisitor.GetDependencies(Flame.Compiler.IExpression)
member.summary: Extracts propagation dependencies from this value.

member.name: P:Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableDefinitionVisitor.TerminatedFlow
member.summary: Gets a flow delta that represents flow termination: sequential flow that succeeds it will never be executed.

member.name: P:Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableDefinitionVisitor.TerminatedGlobalFlow
member.summary: Gets a flow delta that represents global flow termination: this signifies the end of this function call.
member.remarks: This really just does nothing at all, because we really don't care about what happens after this.

member.name: P:Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableDefinitionVisitor.CurrentFlow
member.summary: Gets or sets the current flow state.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableFlowHelpers.Succeed(Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableDefinitionChain,Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableDefinitionReach,Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableDefinitionReach,Flame.Optimization.InsertStatement)
member.summary: Creates a variable definition that "succeeds" the old variable definition.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableFlowHelpers.Transfer(Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableDefinitionChain,Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableDefinitionReach,Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableDefinitionReach,Flame.Optimization.InsertStatement)
member.summary: "Transfers" the old variable definition's value to the new one. Both definition reaches are registered with the definition chain.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableFlowHelpers.Materialize(Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableDefinitionChain,Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableDefinitionReach,Flame.Optimization.InsertStatement)
member.summary: "Materializes" the given variable definition, using an insertion point. If the given variable definition has an underlying variable, it is returned unchanged. Otherwise, a new variable definition is returned that does contain an underlying variable, with the previous definition's value.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableFlowHelpers.MakeVolatile(Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableDefinitionChain,Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableDefinitionReach,Flame.Optimization.InsertStatement)
member.summary: Marks the given variable definition as volatile. This will disable most, if not all, optimizations.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableFlowHelpers.Phi(Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableDefinitionChain,Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableDefinitionReach,Flame.Optimization.InsertStatement,Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableDefinitionReach,Flame.Optimization.InsertStatement)
member.summary: Selects one of two variable definitions. If the given variable definitions are the same definition, said variable definition is returned. Otherwise, a both are assigned to a variable, and a variable definition is returned that wraps that variable.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableFlowHelpers.CreateLocal(Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableDefinitionReach)
member.summary: Creates or retrieves a local variable to use as this variable definition reach's backing storage.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableFlowHelpers.CreateLocal(Flame.Optimization.Variables.LocalVariableDescription)
member.summary: Creates or retrieves a local variable that is equal to or of the same type as the given described local variable.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableFlowHelpers.CreatePhiLocal(Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableDefinitionReach,Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableDefinitionReach)
member.summary: Creates or retrieves a local variable to use as the backing storage for the new phi definition for these variables. These definitions should represent the same original local variable.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableFlowHelpers.CreatePhiLocal(Flame.Optimization.Variables.LocalVariableDescription,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1{Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableDefinitionReach})
member.summary: Creates or retrieves a local variable to use as the backing storage for the new phi definition for these variables. These definitions should represent the same original local variable.

member.name: T:Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableFlowNode
member.summary: A type of node that describes variable flow.

member.name: T:Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableFlowState
member.summary: Defines a variable flow state, which is a singly linked list of sequential variable flow bodies.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableFlowState.AsCons
member.summary: Casts this variable flow state to a nonempty variable flow state. Please use this alongside `IsCons`.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableFlowState.ToFlow
member.summary: Converts this variable flow state to sequential flow.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableFlowState.Cons(Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableFlowNode)
member.summary: Creates a new nonempty flow state by "appending" the given node to this flow state. No state is mutated.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableFlowState.Concat(Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableFlowState)
member.summary: Concatenates two variable flow states.

member.name: P:Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableFlowState.IsCons
member.summary: Tests if this variable flow state is nonempty.

member.name: P:Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableFlowState.IsNil
member.summary: Tests if this variable flow state is empty.

member.name: P:Flame.Optimization.Variables.VariableFlowState.PostInsert
member.summary: Returns the insert point directly after the variable flow state's body.

member.name: T:Flame.Optimization.Variables.NilVariableFlowState
member.summary: An empty variable flow state.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.Variables.NilVariableFlowState.ToFlow
member.summary: Converts this variable flow state to sequential flow.

member.name: T:Flame.Optimization.Variables.ConsVariableFlowState
member.summary: A nonempty variable flow state.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.Variables.ConsVariableFlowState.ToFlow
member.summary: Converts this variable flow state to sequential flow.

member.name: P:Flame.Optimization.Variables.AccessCount.Static_Singleton.Infinity
member.summary: Gets an access count that represents an infinite number of accesses.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.Variables.PropagationDependencies.Static_Singleton.Single(Flame.Optimization.Variables.PropagationMode,Flame.Optimization.Variables.LocalVariableDescription)
member.summary: Gets propagation dependencies that depend on a single local, propagated as per the given propagation scheme.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.Variables.PropagationDependencies.Static_Singleton.None(Flame.Optimization.Variables.PropagationMode)
member.summary: Gets propagation "dependencies" that do not depend on any locals, but do use the given dependency scheme.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.Variables.PropagationDependencies.Static_Singleton.Always(Flame.Optimization.Variables.LocalVariableDescription)
member.summary: Gets propagation dependencies that represent the perpetual propagation of a value, given that the the argument's definition does not change.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.Variables.PropagationDependencies.Static_Singleton.Always
member.summary: Gets propagation dependencies that represent the perpetual propagation of a value, irrespective of changes to variables.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.Variables.PropagationDependencies.Static_Singleton.Once(Flame.Optimization.Variables.LocalVariableDescription)
member.summary: Gets propagation dependencies that represent a single propagation of a value, given that the the argument's definition does not change.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.Variables.PropagationDependencies.Static_Singleton.Once
member.summary: Gets propagation dependencies that represent a single propagation of a value, irrespective of changes to variables.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.Variables.PropagationDependencies.Static_Singleton.Never
member.summary: Gets propagation dependencies that bar any form of propagation.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.AccessChecker.Static_Singleton.CanAccess(Flame.IType,Flame.Compiler.IStatement)
member.summary: Determines whether the given type can access all types and members that are referenced by the given statement.

member.name: P:Flame.Optimization.SpeculativeFlowState.Static_Singleton.TerminatedFlow
member.summary: Gets a speculative flow state that represents terminated flow.

member.name: P:Flame.Optimization.SpeculativeFlowState.Static_Singleton.InitialFlow
member.summary: Gets a speculative flow state that represents initial flow.

member.name: P:Flame.Optimization.InitialFlowState.Static_Singleton.TerminatedFlow
member.summary: Gets an initial flow state that represents terminated flow.

member.name: P:Flame.Optimization.InitialFlowState.Static_Singleton.InitialFlow
member.summary: Gets an initial flow state that represents initial flow.

member.name: P:Flame.Optimization.InitialFlowState.Static_Singleton.NonInitialFlow
member.summary: Gets an initial flow state that represents non-initial flow.

member.name: M:Flame.Optimization.SizeVisitor.Static_Singleton.ApproximateSize(Flame.Compiler.IStatement,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Approximates the given statement's size, based on the given parameters.
